alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Shawano; Waupaca (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 12:05PM CDT until May 01 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wolf River near Shiocton affecting Waupaca, Shawano and Outagamie Counties. For the Lower Wolf River...including Shiocton, New London, Lake Poygan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wolf River near Shiocton. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, There is minor flooding at the city park along with lowland and adjacent agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CDT Saturday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.5 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 04/16/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
